{{also|halle|hallé|hälle|hallë|Hälle}} ==English== {{wikipedia|Halle (Saale)}} ===Etymology=== {{rfelite|en}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{q|female given name}} {{enPR|hălē}}, {{IPA|en|/ˈhæli/}} ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # A [[city]] in [[Saxony-Anhalt]], Germany. # {{given name|en|female}}. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=aehll|Hella|hella|hella-}} [[Category:en:Cities in Germany]] ---- ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈhalə/}} * {{rhymes|de|alə}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|halle}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|halla}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*hallō}}, ultimately from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*ḱel-||to hide, cover, conceal}}. Compare {{cog|nds|Hall}}, {{cog|nl|hal}}, {{cog|en|hall}}, Danish and Swedish {{m|sv|hall}}. ====Noun==== {{de-noun|f||Hallen}} # [[hall]] =====Declension===== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|de|Hallenbad}}, {{l|de|Hallenschwimmbad}}, {{l|de|Schwimmhalle}} * {{l|de|Kaufhalle}} * {{l|de|Leichenhalle}} * {{l|de|Spielhalle}} ===Etymology 2=== Attested in early manuscripts as ''Halla''. ====Proper noun==== {{wikipedia|lang=de|Halle (Saale)}} {{de-proper noun|n}} # {{l|en|Halle}}, a city in [[Saxony-Anhalt]] near the river [[Saale]], Germany # any of several other cities with the same name =====Synonyms===== * {{sense|Halle, city in Saxony-Anhalt}} {{l|de|Halle [[an]] [[der]] [[Saale]]}}, {{l|de|Halle a/S.}}, {{l|de|Halle a. d. S.}}, {{l|de|Halle a. S.}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Cities in Germany]]
